alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 7:24AM MDT until June 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by last nights excessive rainfall is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following counties, Morgan and Washington. * WHEN...Until 115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 AM MDT, local law enforcement relayed flooding in the advisory area due to thunderstorms last night. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen overnight. Highway 63 between Anton and Akron remains closed along with Highway 34 between Akron and Otis. Many other county roads may also be impassable. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Otis, Elba, Anton, Lindon, Platner, Midway, Woodlin School, Arickaree School, Woodrow, Gary, Last Chance, Fremont Butte and Hyde.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
